title: pinged and being told to fk off when you are last hitting their lane whilst they are at base
body: What is wrong with some people, I am really annoyed by this, during my jungle route I see that enemy minions are grouped at or near our tower so I decide that I need the xp and gold so I last hit the creeps, Then in come the alert pings telling me to FK OFF!!! why? how is it bad that I am last hitting creeps you are clearly going to miss while you are at base? you are not losing any gold and I'm getting some much needed XP. so seriously next time a jungler comes to last hit at your lane while you are not there and you start doing shit like this. Don't be surprised if he decided to stay and aoe 2 whole minions waves because you were being a DKhead.

replies.body: I'll let them stay and farm my minions until I've gotten back to lane, it actually somewhat bugs me when someone could of got plenty of gold and xp off the minions killing my turret while I'm running up to lane and they let my turret die to kill 1 camp.

Some odd players don't mind if their tower gets destroyed though. Unless the team will clearly lose or the player is just plain bad, I usually don't mind if my team loses an Outer Turret, Inner and Inhibitor Turrets are a different case though that is if I'm not in that lane or if I'm the jungler.

Last hitting still pushes the wave, the laner might have wanted to freeze lane, if the creeps are under your turret then fine but if not stay the fuck away because you will screw there lane up, countless times in low elo i've seen my teammates take my creeps for no reason and then i'm forced to go do the jungle monsters because my lane is pretty much fucked and perma frozen for the enemy.
Probably because you're still touching their lane minions, maybe its their plan to freeze lane or not to push it.
yes but if you are last hitting you are not pushing the lane are you?

For the record, it actually doesn't matter if you're last hitting to the best of your ability, you will still push the lane ever so slightly. You can search this up, there have been videos in Youtube that discuss this.

If the minions are already under tower and the next wave of enemy minions are already nearby then I guess a jungler could clean up a bit. 

I've played with many {{champion:75}}es that ping me to get off their lane, in a similar situation to this, mainly because they want to get all of the minions and for a Nasus it doesn't matter if he/she loses an Outer Turret because it plays to his/her advantage; letting one last hit and stack Q with a less chance of enemy jungler or laner interference .

As a top laner I'd much prefer it if jungle freezes my lane until I get there. Too many scrubs don't realise their wave resets and pushes the enemy if their tower kills the wave instead of jungle freezing. Win win as far as I'm concerned.

It can be very situational. 
I agree if they are dying to tower and there's no TP, enjoy it. 
In other situations make sure you factor where the wave is going to end up so you don't screw over your top laner.
actually its a good trait to have in a jungler since it also relieves lane pressure. nice work
I admit i've pinged for people to get offa my farm.
